message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which has been meticulously crafted to provide unparalleled value. This product is not just an item but a solution tailored to enhance your experience. I am offering it to you for $120. I believe this price reflects the quality and benefits it brings. Let me know if you're interested in discussing further.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. I'm looking to get the best value for my money, and I'm not sure if $120 is the best fit for my budget.

Thank you for considering our product, Bob. I understand your perspective on the pricing. In order to accommodate your budget while still valuing our product's quality and unique features, I propose a price of $105. This is slightly above your initial suggestion but remains within a reasonable range for the value we offer. I hope this proposal works for you, and I look forward to your response.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, Alice. However, I'm still a bit hesitant to go up to $105. I was thinking more along the lines of $95. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to make sure I'm getting the best deal possible.

I appreciate your efforts to find a mutually beneficial agreement, Bob. After careful consideration, I would like to offer the product to you for $100. This price aligns closely with both our expectations and the value provided by the product. I believe this is a fair deal that respects your budget while ensuring a reasonable return for us. I hope this proposal meets your requirements, and I look forward to your positive response.

I'm getting close to accepting, Alice, but I'm still a bit off on the price. I'm willing to meet you at $98. I think that's a fair price for the product, and I'm willing to make a decision if you can meet me there.
